channel.title: How Well Do you Know History?
channel.description:
Hey , I Just Got Borad so I Made a Quiz ....
When Did the English Land on The New Land ? __________ - 10 Points
Who is President in The U.S.A Today ? - 5 Points __________
Who in Said "Give me Liberty or Give me Death" ? - 10 Points __________
Why Do We Call the Indian's , Indian's ? - 12 Points
_________
Who Freed the Slave's ? - 10 Points __________
When Was RuneScape Built ? - 5 Points ________
[b]Rule's : No Flamming Anyone (Dont Laugh) No Copying (Just Scroll Down and Answer Dont Cheat (Dont Seach Web's) and The Rest of The Mopar Rules [/b]
Have Fun :)

item.title: How Well Do you Know History?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Mod Andy:

Hey , I Just Got Borad so I Made a Quiz …

I just got Borat, so I answered your quiz…

  1. They’ve been landing here between the founding of Jamestown and today.
  2. Craig A. Dubow
  3. Many people have quoted Patrick Henry’s, “Give me liberty or give me death.” Including me.
  4. Because they are from India.
  5. There were many people who freed slaves, Harriet Tubman among them.
  6. 4 Jan 2001.

Yea, all my answers are right, don’t even bother checking them.

Read full topic
item.source: How Well Do you Know History?

[quote=“Mod Andy, post:8, topic:134537”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=185934.msg1682389#msg1682389 date=1187397875]
1492
George W. Bush
Patrick Henry
Chris Columbus
In the US, slaves were considered free after Abe Lincoln announced the Emancipation Proclamation.
RS Classic was made in 2001

do you see now why i do good in school.
[/quote]

You Copyed Word to Word of Mod Taharok’s Answer’s !

[quote author=Mod Andy link=topic=185934.msg1682352#msg1682352 date=1187397169]
Rule’s :
No Flamming Anyone (Dont Laugh)
No Copying (Just Scroll Down and Answer

and The Rest of The Mopar Rules
[/quote][/quote]
lol duh

item.title: How Well Do you Know History?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Nope, it says in the wiki that they completely rewrote it, this time his brother helping him. That is why the Graphics in RS Classic pwn the Graphics in MUD.

Anyways, it doesn’t matter.

Read full topic

item.title: How Well Do you Know History?
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:7, topic:134537”]Wait, RuneScape was made in 2001. Devious MUD, an entirely different project, was started by Andrew Gower in 1999. After the second version of MUD which was released for one week, he trashed it. Then Constant Tedder and Andrew’s brother, Paul Gower, came together to form Jagex and make RuneScape.

en.wikipedia.org

RuneScape

RuneScape, sometimes referred to as RuneScape 3, is a fantasy massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) developed and published by Jagex, first released in January 2001. RuneScape was originally a browser game built with the Java programming language, but was largely replaced by a standalone C++-coded client in 2016. The game has had over 200 million accounts created and is recognised by the Guinness World Records as the world's largest and most-updated free MMORPG. RuneScape ...

I looked it up months ago. :)[/quote]
I read the Wiki of RuneScape around 6 months ago. I personally consider Devious MUD RuneScape because they just changed the name.

Read full topic
item.source: How Well Do you Know History?

en.wikipedia.org

RuneScape

RuneScape, sometimes referred to as RuneScape 3, is a fantasy massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) developed and published by Jagex, first released in January 2001. RuneScape was originally a browser game built with the Java programming language, but was largely replaced by a standalone C++-coded client in 2016. The game has had over 200 million accounts created and is recognised by the Guinness World Records as the world's largest and most-updated free MMORPG. RuneScape ...

item.title: How Well Do you Know History?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

  1. 1492
  2. George W. Bush
  3. Patrick Henry
  4. Chris Columbus made a mistake when he reached the new world. He thought that he had reached India, so he called the Native Americans ‘Indians’.
  5. In the US, slaves were considered free after Abe Lincoln announced the Emancipation Proclamation.
  6. RS Classic was made in 2001

Read full topic
